page.title: 06Westcott Farm History
page.content: The farm is recorded in the original Doomsday survey. There is a neolithic henge, now a registered{ancient {monument},near the farmhouse, thus indicating farming has existed on this site for the last 5000 years. One of the disused outbuildings contains a recently restored{cider} press. As Mr.Hambly's family have owned the farm since 1830 he was able to explain that the press produced cider for the family and the farmworkers during the whole of the{ {nineteenth century}and probably before that. After renovation five years ago this one-horse-powered press has produced several barrels of cider. Part of Mr.Hambly's spare time is taken up with the duties of being the {Portreave}of Callington.
